titleStmt.title: To the Facetious Epigrammatist, my louing Kinsman, Mr. Robert Hayman, who composed these quaint Quodlibets at Harbor-grace, in Newfound-Land.
titleStmt.author: Spicer, Richard

analytic.title: To the Facetious Epigrammatist, my louing Kinsman, Mr. Robert Hayman, who composed these quaint Quodlibets at Harbor-grace, in Newfound-Land.
analytic.author: Spicer, Richard

monogr.title: Quodlibets, lately come ouer from New Britaniola, old Newfound-land : Epigrams and other small parcels, both morall and diuine. The first foure bookes being the authors owne: the rest translated out of that excellent epigrammatist, Mr. Iohn Owen, and other rare authors: wit two epistles of that excellently wittie doctor, Francis Rablais: translated out of his French at large. All of them composed and done at Harbor-Grace in Britaniola, anciently called Newfound-Land. By R.H. sometimes Gouernour of the plantation there
monogr.author: Hayman, Robert

div.head: To the Facetious Epigrammatist, my louing Kinsman, Mr. Robert Hayman, who composed these quaint Quodlibets at Harbor-grace, in Newfound-Land.
div.l: YOur modest lines begot in Harbor-Grace,
Doe grace that Harbor in old Newfound-Land,
Your witty lines the Muses doe imbrace.
Seeing such sweet flowers from that barren soyle,
As your neat Quodlibets which there did spring,
To Owens Genius you haue giuen the foyle.
By your sweet Epigrams, you there did sing.
I would you had the grace with our great King;
To doe there your desires: A greater thing.
